page.title: 14St.James's Church 2
page.content: The font is near the door of the church and is made of marble and is very heavy. There is a wooden cover for it and on it are some designs with a piece of wood sticking out of the middle where you lift it up. The font also has a little plughole. The altar has a cloth over it with real cloth of gold designs over it. On the side are marble designs of Jesus in the middle, Mary on his left and Joseph on her left. On Jesus's right is St.John and after him St.George the patron saint of England. There are lovely paintings in the Nave which the Victorians painted. James Carter Bournehall JMI
